docs.snippet: A reminder that, after all the seriousness, a little humor would be a good thing at this year's Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: Anne Thompson points at Funny or Die, highlighting a set piece of David Spade as Daniel Day-Lewis as Daniel Plainview, giving a Socratic discourse on why there must be an Oscar ceremony this year. It's a reminder that just a small touch of funny would not hurt the ceremonies one bit this year. Funny is hard, but Spade makes it look pretty easy.
docs.abstract: A reminder that, after all the seriousness, a little humor would be a good thing at this year's Oscars.

headline.main: There Will be Milkshakes. And Frocks

docs.snippet: Madonna and Gwyneth Paltrow at fundraiser at the U.N. for Unicef and Malawi. (Kevin Mazur/WireImage) Last night's fundraiser at the U.N. for Unicef and Malawi was a wild end to an eventful day. At one point yesterday I was in a café on 10th Avenu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Last night's fundraiser at the U.N. for Unicef and Malawi was a wild end to an eventful day. At one point yesterday I was in a café on 10th Avenue, having a lonely bowl of minestrone and listening on the phone to a designer rant (didn't like the review: O.K.), and the next I was squeezing into the throng at the United Nations behind Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes. This was a little surreal. I mean, I've seen Cruise and Holmes at other parties. I remember seeing Cruise at a Vanity Fair Oscar party when he was married to Nicole Kidman. But it was funny seeing him last night, because Demi Moore swept up with Ashton Kushner and gave Cruise a big bear hug. I stepped around them, and saw Gwyneth Paltrow. People had that deer-in-the-headlights look: "It's Gwyneth." I thought she looked beautiful. I saw Narciso Rodriguez and Diane von Furstenberg, who was with her husband Barry Diller. The place was packed. The dinner crowd moved into a tent set up on the U.N. lawn, and, as Madonna reminded everyone, when she made her speech, we weren't technically in the United States anymore.
docs.abstract: Madonna and Gwyneth Paltrow at fundraiser at the U.N. for Unicef and Malawi. (Kevin Mazur/WireImage) Last night's fundraiser at the U.N. for Unicef and Malawi was a wild end to an eventful day. docs.snippet: Do those screeners mailed to Academicians really increase film piracy?...
docs.lead_paragraph: There has long been a theory that the release of Oscar screeners is a source of copyrighted entertainment for pirates, but the Gold Rush blog has a spreadsheet that demonstrates that movies often go viral long before the screeners hit the mailbox.
docs.abstract: Do those screeners mailed to Academicians really increase film piracy?
